p: On the other hand, human monoclonal antibodies or their fragments developed in the lab have shown encouraging results as well. Tian et al. confirmed the binding of a human monoclonal antibody CR3022 to the receptor-binding domain (RBD) of 2019-nCoV with high affinity [ 214], highlighting the therapeutic potential of CR3022 toward COVID-19, though further in vitro and in vivo studies are required before it could be used clinically.
